intro: Hymenoxys ambigens var. wagneri, commonly known as the Wagner's hymenoxys, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. This variant is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and subtle morphological differences from the typical form of Hymenoxys ambigens.
